title: Install Caffe2 through anaconda3, can not have GPU support
body_html:
I used the anaconda to install caffe2 and pytorch in the same environment.
conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7

However, it shows the caffe2 does not have GPU support, while pytorch has.

from caffe2.python import workspace; print(workspace.NumCudaDevices())
==>> WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
==>> 0

torch.cuda.is_available()
==>> True

System Info

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.0
  • Python version: 3.6.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0 / 7.0
  • GPU models and configuration: GTX 1070
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.5
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

I used the anaconda to install caffe2 and pytorch in the same environment.
conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7
However, it shows the caffe2 does not have GPU support, while pytorch has.

body:
I used the anaconda to install caffe2 and pytorch in the same environment. 
`conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7`

However, it shows the caffe2 does not have GPU support, while pytorch has.

`from caffe2.python import workspace; print(workspace.NumCudaDevices())`
==>> WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
==>> 0

`torch.cuda.is_available()`
